Def.Name: SandbarWillow
Def.Description: Shrub or small tree forming thickets on sand or gravel. Grows to 20' tall.
Def.Leaves: Narrow lance-shaped and pointed on both ends. 1 1/2" - 6" long and 1/16" - 3/8" wide. Shallow wide spaced teeth (or smooth) on margins. Green and smooth, lighter below.
Def.Twigs: Red-brown and smooth. May in rare cases have hairs. Buds have one scale the covers like cap.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Cluster of capsules, with lots of seeds. Both male and female catkins.
Def.Range: Native to most of North America except for the southeast and far north, occurring from Alaska east to New Brunswick, and south to northern Mexico.
Def.Remarks: Sandbar willow is adapted to sandy soils in stream, river, and shoreline. Provides wood and shelter for many birds and food for deer.
